item.title: Virtuous Setup Balance Talk
item.dc:creator: Napoleon
item.description:
[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!
[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Case Closed (Night) - Very carefully examine a player tonight. If they are a member of the Blue Dragon or the Hand of Byzantium , learn their exact class. - 2 uses

Thinking this should be able to find the Arbiter/Visionary. Marshal, as a guaranteed PR, should probably have some advantage over other investigatives. Being able to find the wolf converter with this ability seems like a good idea. It’s already encouraged to use it first because it’s essentially the same thing as the regular cop, except it tells you the exact wolf class you’re investigating. Meaning, you lose no utility and gain some. Might as well make it possible to find the wolf converter using this, right?

One problem I see with this is the ability to generate massive swing. If you find Arbiter night 1, for example, it’s most likely a big issue for the wolves. But that’s why it’s up for debate.

You could consider only making this ability available N2 or N3.

Read full topic

item.title: Virtuous Setup Balance Talk
item.dc:creator: Vulgard
item.description:
More stuff.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Letter with no Sender (Day) - Sends an anonymous message to a player. - Infinite uses
Cryptic Communications (Night) - Sends an anonymous message to a player and they will be able to post a reply. - Infinite uses

Just a thought, but maybe we could extend this to two messages? Or three? This is the Exiled, by the way. Especially Letter with no Sender feels underpowered if you can only use it once per day.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Piety (Day) - If any player not aligned with the Unseen faction visits you this coming night, they will be prevented and bled. You cannot use Malleus Maleficarum after using Piety.- One use

The night after using Piety. I think that was the intended effect, but the wording is kinda weird.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

The Illusionist

Unseen Social
Telepathy (Day) - Send a 1000 character message to target player. You may not target the King with this - 3 uses

I don’t like how confirmable this is at the moment. Should probably be reworked. Illusionist is not a Prestige class and should not be able to prove itself with trivial ease like this.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Wall of Fire (Night) - Summon a wall of fire at a player’s door, preventing everyone from visiting them. - 2 uses

Everyone else. With the current wording, you are also preventing yourself, which prevents you from preventing others… endless cycle.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Dark Rune (Night) - Prevent any negative affects from affecting the player tonight. - Infinite uses

Does this include conversion? Should probably be rewritten.

Dark Rune (Night) – Protect a player from negative effects. They include occupation, redirection, and conversion. (Bleeding? Bounty? Being easier to lynch? (Judge, Archduke) What about that stuff?)

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Chaotic Wine (Day) - After 3 days you can poison the The King, causing him to die in two nights if not healed by a Herbalist/Physician. If the King is a member of the Unseen , you will take your own life. - One use

Isn’t the current delay in ToL one night, not two? Meaning, it should kill in the same cycle? I wonder if it should be like this here too. Also, does the King get notified? It should probably be included in the description.

item.title: Virtuous Setup Balance Talk
item.dc:creator: Vulgard
item.description:
[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Case Closed (Night) - Very carefully examine a player tonight. If they are a member of the Blue Dragon or the Hand of Byzantium, learn their exact class. - 2 uses

Thinking this should be able to find the Arbiter/Visionary. Marshal, as a guaranteed PR, should probably have some advantage over other investigatives. Being able to find the wolf converter with this ability seems like a good idea. It’s already encouraged to use it first because it’s essentially the same thing as the regular cop, except it tells you the exact wolf class you’re investigating. Meaning, you lose no utility and gain some. Might as well make it possible to find the wolf converter using this, right?

One problem I see with this is the ability to generate massive swing. If you find Arbiter night 1, for example, it’s most likely a big issue for the wolves. But that’s why it’s up for debate.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Expert Investigation (Night) - If a player is a member of the Blue Dragon or the Hand of Byzantium, learn their faction. - Infinite uses

Quality of life change – I think the wording here is weird. Maybe it should say this?

Expert Investigation (Night) - Learn if a player is a member of the Blue Dragon or the Hand of Byzantium. - Infinite uses

I think it’s easier to understand that way, while retaining the same functionality. The idea is that you can’t find a neutral with this, but you can find groupscum. I don’t think this rewording changes the meaning.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Scout (Day) - Your scout will inform you whether a particular player has been visited by a member of the Blue Dragon or the Hand of Byzantium tonight and the faction of the player that visited your target if so. - Infinite uses

Should absolutely see Visionary/Arbiter visits, no question. I thought it already could, to be honest. Same with Peerless Confidant, which is essentially the same thing but on two players.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Tireless (Passive) - If you do not perform an action at night, you will learn if any of your previous uses of Expert Investigation and Case Closed showed incorrect results and which ones were incorrect.

If my proposed change to Case Closed is accepted, this should be reworded.

Tireless (Passive) - If you do not perform an action at night, you will learn if any of your previous uses of Expert Investigation showed incorrect results and which ones were incorrect.

The only reason it included Case Closed beforehand was that Case Closed couldn’t find the Visionary/Arbiter. I think that’s how it was.

item.title: Virtuous Setup Balance Talk
item.dc:creator: Vulgard
item.description:
I’m trying to think of something in the last game that posed a problem setup-wise.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Brand of Sacrifice (Day) - Bleed target player. - One use
Haemophilia (Day) - Increases the power of Funeral Pyre tonight. - 3 uses, 1 day cooldown

I think the cooldown on Haemophilia is fine. I don’t know why only one bleed is allowed. If you are using a bleed, you can’t use Haemophilia, meaning you have to alternate. I don’t think it’d be a bad thing to add another bleed.

It also allows you to claim Poacher more easily, like EVO tried to do.

[SFoL] SFoL 58: Virtuous II — Return of the Fallen — FINALE -- Day 5 (4/16): Imperial Triumph — The Hand of Byzantium, The Fool, and The Strigoi Win!

Funeral Pyre (Night) - Set your target ablaze, killing them. If Haemophilia is used, the target is immune to visits from others except you, and anyone who attempts to visit them is also killed by the flames. In addition, Funeral Pyre will bypass death immunity on the initial target and not count as a visit. - Infinite uses

This effect is super strong. I don’t think removing the cooldown from Haemophilia is a good thing.
